active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the effectiveness of Clark-Wilson Enforcement Rules (E1-E4) versus Bell-LaPadula's confidentiality-focused rules for modern financial applications. Provide evidence from real-world breaches (e.g., banking fraud) and propose hybrid improvements.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert CISSP-aligned flashcard generator specializing in cybersecurity integrity models. Generate high-quality MCQ flashcards for the topic 'Enforcement Rules (E1-E4)' in the Clark-Wilson Integrity Model (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Security Models > Integrity Models > Clark-Wilson Model > Enforcement Rules E1-E4). Ignore NIST SP 800-53 attributions; focus exclusively on Clark-Wilson (1987). Key Definitions: - E1: System must validate each TP prior to execution. - E2: System must bind/authenticate users to IVPs before TP use. - E3: System enforces separation of duties (e.g., via TP/TP/TP triples). - E4: System generates/maintains audit logs for all TP executions. Prerequisites: CDIs (protected data), UDIs, TPs (certified transactions), IVPs (verification). Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [insert array above] - Active Learning: Use for scenario-based cards. - Scaffolding: Distribute cards across 4 layers (5-8 per layer). - Schema: [insert schema above] Output ONLY a numbered list of flashcards in JSON format: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'correct_answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'distractors': ['d1', 'd2', 'd3'], 'references': '...'}}, ...]. Ensure pedagogical depth, accuracy, and distractor quality.
